departments.name: Department of Agriculture
departments.mission: We provide leadership on food, agriculture, natural resources, rural development, nutrition, and related issues based on sound public policy, the best available science, and efficient management.

departments.name: Department of Commerce
departments.mission: The mission of the Department is to create the conditions for economic growth and opportunity.

departments.name: Department of Defense
departments.mission: The mission of the Department of Defense is to provide the military forces needed to deter war and to protect the security of our country.
departments.description: For reasons of national security, Department of Defense (including Army, Navy, Air Force, and DOD itself) contract and IDV data is subject to a 90-day publication delay (i.e., DOD procurement awards cannot be published until 90 days have elapsed after the award Action Date). Other DOD data (including financial assistance and account data) are not subject to this delay. Read more about this delay on our About the Data page.

departments.name: Department of Education
departments.mission: ED's mission is to promote student achievement and preparation for global competitiveness by fostering educational excellence and ensuring equal access.

departments.name: Department of Energy
departments.mission: The mission of the Energy Department is to ensure America's security and prosperity by addressing its energy, environmental and nuclear challenges through transformative science and technology solutions.

departments.name: Department of Health and Human Services
departments.mission: It is the mission of the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) to enhance and protect the health and well-being of all Americans. We fulfill that mission by providing for effective health and human services and fostering advances in medicine, public health, and social services.
departments.frecDescription: Department of Health and Human Services

subtiers.name: Department of Health and Human Services

departments.name: Department of Homeland Security
departments.mission: With honor and integrity, we will safeguard the American people, our homeland, and our values.

departments.name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
departments.mission: HUD's mission is to create strong, sustainable, inclusive communities and quality affordable homes for all. HUD is working to strengthen the housing market to bolster the economy and protect consumers; meet the need for quality affordable rental homes; utilize housing as a platform for improving quality of life; build inclusive and sustainable communities free from discrimination, and transform the way HUD does business.
departments.frecDescription: Department of Housing and Urban Development

subtiers.name: Department of Housing and Urban Development

departments.name: Department of the Interior
departments.mission: The Department of the Interior protects and manages the Nation's natural resources and cultural heritage; provides scientific and other information about those resources; and honors its trust responsibilities or special commitments to American Indians, Alaska Natives, and affiliated island communities.

departments.name: Department of Justice
departments.mission: To enforce the law and defend the interests of the United States according to the law; to ensure public safety against threats foreign and domestic; to provide federal leadership in preventing and controlling crime; to seek just punishment for those guilty of unlawful behavior; and to ensure fair and impartial administration of justice for all Americans.

departments.name: Department of Labor
departments.mission: To foster, promote, and develop the welfare of the wage earners, job seekers, and retirees of the United States; improve working conditions; advance opportunities for profitable employment; and assure work-related benefits and rights.

departments.name: Department of State
departments.mission: The Department's mission is to shape and sustain a peaceful, prosperous, just, and democratic world and foster conditions for stability and progress for the benefit of the American people and people everywhere. This mission is shared with the USAID, ensuring we have a common path forward in partnership as we invest in the shared security and prosperity that will ultimately better prepare us for the challenges of tomorrow.

departments.name: Department of Transportation
departments.mission: Serve the United States by ensuring a fast, safe, efficient, accessible and convenient transportation system that meets our vital national interests and enhances the quality of life of the American people, today and into the future.

departments.name: Department of the Treasury
departments.mission: Maintain a strong economy and create economic and job opportunities by promoting the conditions that enable economic growth and stability at home and abroad, strengthen national security by combating threats and protecting the integrity of the financial system, and manage the U.S. Government's finances and resources effectively.

departments.name: Department of Veterans Affairs
departments.mission: To fulfill President Lincoln's promise To care for him who shall have borne the battle, and for his widow, and his orphan by serving and honoring the men and women who are America's veterans.

departments.name: Department of the Air Force
departments.comments: Agency has numerous subtiers subsumed under DOD (097) submissions. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

departments.name: U.S. Postal Service
departments.comments: Only the Postal Regulatory Commission is reporting, not USPS as a whole. They share a CGAC.

departments.name: Department of the Army
departments.comments: Agency has numerous subtiers subsumed under DOD (097) submissions. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

departments.name: Department of the Navy
departments.comments: Agency has numerous subtiers subsumed under DOD (097) submissions. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: General Services Administration
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of GSA is to deliver the best value in real estate, acquisition, and technology services to government and the American people.

independentAgencies.name: National Aeronautics and Space Administration
independentAgencies.mission: Drive advances in science, technology, aeronautics, and space exploration to enhance knowledge, education, innovation, economic vitality, and stewardship of Earth.

independentAgencies.name: Small Business Administration
independentAgencies.mission: To maintain and strengthen the nation's economy by enabling the establishment and vitality of small businesses and to assist in the economic recovery of communities after disasters.

independentAgencies.name: Environmental Protection Agency
independentAgencies.mission: Our mission is to protect human health and the environment.

independentAgencies.name: National Science Foundation
independentAgencies.mission: To promote the progress of science; to advance the national health, prosperity, and welfare; to secure the national defense; and for other purposes.

independentAgencies.name: Office of Personnel Management
independentAgencies.mission: Recruit, retain, and honor a world-class workforce to serve the American people.

independentAgencies.name: Social Security Administration
independentAgencies.mission: Deliver Social Security services that meet the changing needs of the public.

independentAgencies.name: 400 Years of African-American History Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 10/5. They already have broker groups but have yet to submit data.

independentAgencies.name: Abraham Lincoln Bicentennial Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Sunset in 2010 and became the Abraham Lincoln Bicentennial Foundation. Possibly the account name hasn't been updated accordingly. In any case, not in A-11

independentAgencies.name: Access Board
independentAgencies.mission: Lead the development, advancement, and implementation of accessibility through outreach, rulemaking (standards and guidelines) and education

independentAgencies.name: Administrative Conference of the U.S.
independentAgencies.mission: ACUS is an independent federal agency charged with convening expert representatives from the public and private sectors to recommend improvements to administrative process and procedure. ACUS initiatives promote efficiency, participation, and fairness in the promulgation of federal regulations and in the administration of federal programs.

independentAgencies.name: Advisory Council on Historic Preservation
independentAgencies.mission: The Advisory Council on Historic Preservation promotes the preservation, enhancement, and sustainable use of our nation's diverse historic resources, and advises the President and the Congress on national historic preservation policy.
independentAgencies.comments: Added FY22 CJ on 11-16-21 (not in standard URL format)

independentAgencies.name: African Development Foundation
independentAgencies.mission: USADF is an independent U.S. Government agency established to support and invest in African owned and led enterprises that improve the lives and livelihoods of people in poor communities in Africa.
independentAgencies.comments: Removed from CGAC = 011 around June 2021 and issued its own non-shared CGAC.

independentAgencies.name: Agency for International Development
independentAgencies.mission: We partner to end extreme poverty and promote resilient, democratic societies while advancing our security and prosperity.

independentAgencies.name: American Battle Monuments Commission
independentAgencies.mission: As the preeminent guardian of America's overseas commemorative cemeteries and memorial, the American Battle Monuments Commission honors the service of the armed forces by designing, constructing, maintaining and operating permanent American cemeteries, and establishing, maintaining, and approving designs of memorials, markers, and monuments where America's armed forces have served beyond our borders.

independentAgencies.name: Appalachian Regional Commission
independentAgencies.mission: ARC's mission is to innovate, partner, and invest to build community capacity and strengthen economic growth in Appalachia.
independentAgencies.comments: Added b/c code in A-11 circular

independentAgencies.name: Armed Forces Retirement Home
independentAgencies.comments: In 1991 Congress incorporated the U.S. Naval Home (opened in 1834) and U. S. Soldiers' and Airmen's Home (founded in 1851) into an independent establishment of the Executive Branch of the Federal Government named the Armed Forces Retirement Home (AFRH) Agency. In 2002, the names of the two homes were officially changed to The Armed Forces Retirement Home - Gulfport and The Armed Forces Retirement Home - Washington.

independentAgencies.name: Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence In Education Foundation
independentAgencies.mission: The Goldwater Scholarship Program, one of the oldest and most prestigious national scholarships in the natural sciences, engineering and mathematics in the United States, seeks to identify and support college sophomores and juniors who show exceptional promise of becoming this Nation's next generation of research leaders in these fields.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: B. Goldwater Scholarship & Excellence in Ed. Fdn.

subtiers.name: Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence In Education Foundation

independentAgencies.comments: Updated URL 11-16-21

independentAgencies.name: Commission for the Preservation of America's Heritage Abroad
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Comm. for Preservation of American Heritage Abroad

subtiers.name: Commission for the Preservation of America's Heritage Abroad

independentAgencies.comments: Still exists; not sure why it isn't in A-11

independentAgencies.name: Commission of Fine Arts
independentAgencies.mission: The Commission of Fine Arts is an independent federal agency charged with giving expert advice to the President, the Congress and the federal and District of Columbia governments on matters of design and aesthetics, as they affect the federal interest and preserve the dignity of the nation's capital.

independentAgencies.name: Commission on Civil Rights
independentAgencies.mission: To inform the development of national civil rights policy and enhance enforcement of federal civil rights laws.

independentAgencies.name: Commission On Combating Synthetic Opioid Trafficking
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Commission on Combating Synthetic Opioid Trafficking
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 8/9/21 since EOP started to submit data (a single TAS) for this one entity. They plan to keep reporting it and don't seem interested in doing so under the agency itself.

independentAgencies.name: Commission to Eliminate Child Abuse And Neglect Fatalities
independentAgencies.frecDescription: COMM TO ELIM CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT FATALITIES
independentAgencies.comments: Expired March 2016. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and is expired. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect.

independentAgencies.name: Committee for Purchase from People Who Are Blind or Severely Disabled
independentAgencies.mission: Our mission is to provide employment opportunities for people who are blind or have significant disabilities in the manufacture and delivery of products and services to the Federal Government.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Committee for Purchase from People Who are Blind

subtiers.name: Committee for Purchase from People Who Are Blind or Severely Disabled

independentAgencies.name: Commodity Futures Trading Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) is to foster open, transparent, competitive, and financially sound markets. By working to avoid systemic risk, the Commission aims to protect market users and their funds, consumers, and the public from fraud, manipulation, and abusive practices related to derivatives and other products that are subject to the Commodity Exchange Act (CEA).

independentAgencies.name: Congressional-Executive Commission on People's Republic of China

subtiers.name: Congressional-Executive Commission on People's Republic of China

independentAgencies.comments: Still exists. Was listed in NIST as under 009, but I moved here.

independentAgencies.name: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
independentAgencies.mission: The CFPB is a 21st century agency that helps consumer finance markets work by making rules more effective, by consistently and fairly enforcing those rules, and by empowering consumers to take more control over their economic lives.

independentAgencies.name: Consumer Product Safety Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Keeping Consumers Safe

independentAgencies.name: Corporation for National and Community Service
independentAgencies.mission: Improving lives, strengthening communities and fortifying the civic health of our nation.

subtiers.name: Corporation for National and Community Service

independentAgencies.name: Corps of Engineers - Civil Works
independentAgencies.mission: Serve the public by providing the Nation with quality and responsive Development and management of the Nation's water resources; Support of commercial navigation;  Restoration, protection and management of aquatic ecosystems; Flood risk management; and Engineering and technical services in an environmentally sustainable, economic, and technically sound manner with a focus on public safety and collaborative partnerships.

independentAgencies.name: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
independentAgencies.mission: Address integrity, economy, and effectiveness issues that transcend individual Government agencies; and increase the professionalism and effectiveness of personnel by developing policies, standards, and approaches to aid in the establishment of a well-trained and highly skilled workforce in the offices of the Inspectors General.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Council of Inspectors Gen. on Integrity & Efficien

subtiers.name: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency

independentAgencies.name: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency
independentAgencies.mission: CSOSA's mission is to enhance public safety, prevent crime and reduce recidivism among those supervised and to support the fair administration of justice in close collaboration with the community.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency

subtiers.name: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency

independentAgencies.comments: 4/8/22 updated FREC description to show the full name (though CARS still has the old one for whatever reason).

independentAgencies.name: Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of the Board shall be to provide independent analysis, advice, and recommendations to the Secretary of Energy to inform the Secretary, in the role of the Secretary as operator and regulator of the defense nuclear facilities of the Department of Energy, in providing adequate protection of public health and safety at such defense nuclear facilities.

independentAgencies.name: Delta Regional Authority
independentAgencies.mission: The Delta Regional Authority will advance its communities through the practical application of innovative ideas and strategies that foster inclusive commuinities, strengthen regional collaboration and capacity, achieve sustained, long-term economic development and produce meaningful opportunities for all the Delta people.

independentAgencies.name: Denali Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The Denali Commission will partner with tribal, federal, state, and local governments and collaborate with all Alaskans to develop basic public infrastructure and enhance the quality of life in Alaska's communities.

independentAgencies.name: District of Columbia Courts
independentAgencies.mission: Comprised of the Court of Appeals, the Superior Court, and the Court System, the District of Columbia Courts constitute the Judicial Branch of the District of Columbia government. The mission of the District of Columbia Courts is to protect rights and liberties, uphold and interpret the law, and resolve disputes peacefully, fairly, and effectively in the District of Columbia.
independentAgencies.comments: 10-24-19 update: Does submit to Broker, but doesn't have a SubTier or seemingly submit contracts or FA (should it?). Needs an icon on the website to go with its new agency page. 2-17-20 update: SubTier registered in FPDS on 12/27/19. Registered Top and Sub in FH on 2/3/20. Added SubTier to our list on 2/17/20.

independentAgencies.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower Memorial Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Too vague or broad to use in Broker. Possibly could be decomposed in future with FR Entity. Update: the only agency associated with this in the CARS file is Dwight D. Eisenhower Memorial Commission. Changing LEGISLATIVE BRANCH BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS to Dwight D. Eisenhower Memorial Commission. Under this name, it was listed in NIST under 009, but I moved here.

independentAgencies.name: Election Assistance Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The Commission shall serve as a national clearinghouse and resource for the compilation of information and review of procedures with respect to the administration of Federal elections by creating and maintaining voluntary voting system guidelines; providing for the testing, certification, decertification, and recertification of voting system hardware and software by accredited laboratories; periodically conducting and making available to the public studies regarding election administration issues; making payments to states to help them procure new voting equipment; developing and carrying out the Help America Vote College Program. - Public Law 107-252

independentAgencies.name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Stop and Remedy Unlawful Employment Discrimination

independentAgencies.name: Executive Office of the President
independentAgencies.mission: The EOP has responsibility for tasks ranging from communicating the President's message to the American people to promoting our trade interests abroad.
independentAgencies.comments: Added FY22 CJ on 11-16-21 (not standard link format)

independentAgencies.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States
independentAgencies.mission: The Export-Import Bank of the United States (EXIM) is the official export credit agency of the United States. EXIM is an independent, self-sustaining Executive Branch agency with a mission of supporting American jobs by facilitating the export of U.S. goods and services.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Export-Import Bank of the United States

subtiers.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

independentAgencies.name: Federal Communications Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The Federal Communications Commission regulates interstate and international communications by radio, television, wire, satellite, and cable in all 50 states, the District of Columbia and U.S. territories. An independent U.S. government agency overseen by Congress, the Commission is the federal agency responsible for implementing and enforcing America's communications law and regulations.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation
independentAgencies.mission: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) is an independent agency created by the Congress to maintain stability and public confidence in the nation's financial system by: insuring deposits; examining and supervising financial institutions for safety and soundness and consumer protection; making large and complex financial institutions resolvable; and managing receiverships.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Election Commission
independentAgencies.mission: To protect the integrity of the federal campaign finance process by providing transparency and fairly enforcing and administering federal campaign finance laws.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Housing Finance Board
independentAgencies.comments: Note that FHFB was superseded by Federal Housing Finance Agency FHFA in 2008. the se subtiers also may not exist anymore.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Labor Relations Authority
independentAgencies.mission: The FLRA promotes stable, constructive labor-management relations through the resolution and prevention of labor disputes in a manner that gives full effect to the collective-bargaining rights of employees, unions, and agencies.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Maritime Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Ensure a competitive and reliable international ocean transportation supply system that supports the U.S. economy and protects the public from unfair and deceptive practices.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service
independentAgencies.mission: FMCS's mission statement reflects the statutory intent of the Agency. Our mission is to: Promote the development of sound and stable labor management relationships; Prevent or minimize work stoppages by assisting labor and management to settle their disputes through mediation; Advocate collective bargaining, mediation and voluntary arbitration as the preferred processes for settling issues between employers and representatives of employees; Develop and advocate the art, science and practice of conflict resolution through the use of ADR; Assist parties in conflict through the provision of conflict resolution services; and Foster the establishment and maintenance of constructive joint processes to improve labor-management relationships, employment security and organizational effectiveness.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission (Commission) is an independent adjudicatory agency that provides administrative trial and appellate review of legal disputes arising under the Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977 (Mine Act), as amended. Section 113 of the Mine Act establishes the Commission and sets forth its responsibilities. The Mine Improvement and New Emergency Response Act of 2006, P.L. 109-236 (MINER Act) added an additional responsibility to the Commission, resolving disputes between the Secretary of Labor and underground coal operators with respect to the contents of emergency response plans or the Secretary's refusal to approve such plans.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Fed. Mine Safety & Health Review Commission

subtiers.name: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

independentAgencies.name: Federal Permitting Improvement Steering Council
independentAgencies.mission: Improve the timeliness, predictability, and transparency of the Federal environmental review and authorization process for large-scale infrastructure projects by serving as an impartial Federal partner responsible for enhancing interagency coordination, increasing  accountability, and overseeing process improvements.
independentAgencies.comments: Used to be part of GSA, but was made a separate agency in 2020. Added the SubTier that now exists and marking as a TopTier. Planning to submit starting FY20Q2. 12/30/21 updated CJ link per agency request.

independentAgencies.name: Federal Trade Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Protecting consumers and competition by preventing anticompetitive, deceptive, and unfair business practices through law enforcement, advocacy, and education without unduly burdening legitimate business activity.
independentAgencies.comments: Updated Mission statement on 12/29/19 per agency request.

independentAgencies.name: Government Accountability Office
independentAgencies.mission: Our Mission is to support the Congress in meeting its constitutional responsibilities and to help improve the performance and ensure the accountability of the federal government for the benefit of the American people. We provide Congress with timely information that is objective, fact-based, nonpartisan, nonideological, fair, and balanced.
independentAgencies.comments: Added FY22 CJ on 11-16-21 (not standard link format)

independentAgencies.name: Gulf Coast Ecosystem Restoration Council
independentAgencies.mission: The Council was formally established in 2015 as a new, independent Federal Agency with a clear mission to implement a long-term, comprehensive plan for the ecological and economic recovery of the Gulf Coast region.

independentAgencies.name: Harry S Truman Scholarship Foundation
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Harry S. Truman Scholarship Trust Fund

independentAgencies.name: Institute of Museum and Library Services
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of IMLS is to inspire libraries and museums to advance innovation, lifelong learning, and cultural and civic engagement. We provide leadership through research, policy development, and grant making.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Institute of Museum and Library Services

subtiers.name: Institute of Museum and Library Services

independentAgencies.comments: getting own CGAC soon (474). Going to go ahead and replace 417 with 474.

independentAgencies.name: Inter-American Foundation
independentAgencies.mission: To identify, support, and partner with the poor, their enterprises and grassroots organizations to create and build thriving communities.
independentAgencies.comments: Removed from CGAC = 011 around June 2021 and issued its own non-shared CGAC.

independentAgencies.name: International Trade Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Consistent with its statutory mandate, the Commission makes determinations in proceedings involving imports claimed to injure a domestic industry or violate U.S. intellectual property rights; provides independent tariff, trade and competitiveness-related analysis and information; and maintains the U.S. tariff schedule.

independentAgencies.name: Japan-United States Friendship Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Fixed FREC for this row on 7/11/19 (transposition error). Also fixed FREC CGAC Association column which was TRUE after this fix.

independentAgencies.name: Marine Mammal Commission
independentAgencies.mission: In 1972, the MMPA established the Marine Mammal Commission to provide independent oversight of the marine mammal conservation policies and programs being carried out by federal regulatory agencies.

independentAgencies.name: Medicare Payment Advisory Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Still exists. Not sure why it isn't in the A-11

independentAgencies.name: Merit Systems Protection Board
independentAgencies.mission: Protect the Merit System Principles and promote an effective Federal workforce free of Prohibited Personnel Practices.

independentAgencies.name: Military Compensation And Retirement Modernization Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Sunset January 1, 2016. Not marking as TopTier because no SubTier and defunct. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect.

independentAgencies.name: Millennium Challenge Corporation
independentAgencies.mission: MCC's mission is to reduce poverty through economic growth.

independentAgencies.name: Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation
independentAgencies.mission: The Udall Foundation's mission is to provide programs to promote leadership, education, collaboration, and conflict resolution in the areas of environment, public lands, and natural resources in order to strengthen Native nations, assist federal agencies and others to resolve environmental conflicts, and to encourage the continued use and appreciation of our nation's rich resources.

subtiers.name: Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation

independentAgencies.name: National Archives and Records Administration
independentAgencies.mission: Our Mission is to provide public access to Federal Government records in our custody and control. Public access to government records strengthens democracy by allowing Americans to claim their rights of citizenship, hold their government accountable, and understand their history so they can participate more effectively in their government.

independentAgencies.name: National Capital Planning Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Added FY22 CJ on 11-16-21 (not standard link format)

independentAgencies.name: National Commission on Libraries and Information Science
independentAgencies.frecDescription: National Commission on Libraries & Info. Science

subtiers.name: National Commission on Libraries and Information Science

independentAgencies.comments: Subsumed by IMLS on March 30, 2008.

independentAgencies.name: National Commission on Military Aviation Safety
independentAgencies.frecDescription: National Commission on Military Aviation Safety
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 7/11/19 due to appearance in the CARS file. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: National Commission on Military, National, and Public Service
independentAgencies.frecDescription: National Commission on Military, National, and Public Service
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 7/11/19 due to appearance in the CARS file. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: National Council on Disability
independentAgencies.mission: NCD's mission is to be a trusted advisor, in collaboration with people with disabilities to: The President; The Congress; Federal entities; State, tribal communities, and local governments; and Other entities and organizations. NCD fulfills its advisory roles regarding disability policies, programs, procedures, and practices that enhance equal opportunity by: Convening stakeholders to acquire timely and relevant input for recommendations and action steps; Gathering and analyzing data and other information; Engaging and influencing current debates and agendas; Identifying and formulating solutions to emerging and long-standing challenges; and Providing tools to facilitate effective implementation.
independentAgencies.comments: Added b/c code in A-11 circular

independentAgencies.name: National Credit Union Administration
independentAgencies.mission: Provide, through regulation and supervision, a safe and sound credit union system, which promotes confidence in the national system of cooperative credit.

independentAgencies.name: National Endowment for the Arts
independentAgencies.mission: The National Endowment for the Arts is an independent federal agency that funds, promotes, and strengthens the creative capacity of our communities by providing all Americans with diverse opportunities for arts participation.
independentAgencies.comments: CGAC conflict; will be resolved soon

independentAgencies.name: National Endowment for the Humanities
independentAgencies.mission: The National Endowment for the Humanities serves and strengthens our nation by supporting high quality projects and programs in the humanities and by making the humanities available to all Americans.
independentAgencies.comments: Received request on 4/9 from FPDS/GSA to add this code. NEH's old code of 5940 was end-dated on 12/31/18. This 4340 code went into use on 10/1/18 and will be the new code henceforth.

independentAgencies.name: National Labor Relations Board
independentAgencies.mission: Protecting workplace democracy and the rights of employees, unions and employers under the National Labor Relations Act, in order to promote commerce and strengthen the Nation's economy.

independentAgencies.name: National Railroad Passenger Corporation Office of the Inspector General
independentAgencies.comments: Added b/c code in A-11 circular. Amtrak IG. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: National Security Commission on Artificial Intelligence
independentAgencies.frecDescription: National Security Commission on Artificial Intelligence
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 7/11/19 due to appearance in the CARS file. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: National Transportation Safety Board
independentAgencies.mission: Independently Advancing Transportation Safety

independentAgencies.name: National Veterans Business Development Corporation
independentAgencies.comments: Not clear this still exists. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: Neighborhood Reinvestment Corporation
independentAgencies.comments: Added b/c code in A-11 Circular. Note that the A-11 circular probably has a typo here. It lists it as 082. but  CARS File has 428, which I'm considering more definitive. Replaced 082 with 428. Note that this SubTier is also listed under Federal Home Loan Bank System in the OMB file. (since removed to avoid duplication). Not sure whether the other nesting is valid.

independentAgencies.name: Northern Border Regional Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of the Northern Border Regional Commission is to catalyze regional, collaborative, and transformative community economic development approaches that alleviate economic distress and position the region for economic growth.
independentAgencies.comments: Added b/c code in A-11 circular. SubTier taken from FPDS file. Didn't actually use HTTPS when I checked on 3/6/20 but adding anyway. Added FY22 CJ on 11-16-21 (not in standard URL format)

independentAgencies.name: Nuclear Regulatory Commission
independentAgencies.mission: To ensure the safe use of radioactive materials for beneficial civilian purposes while protecting people and the environment.

independentAgencies.name: Nuclear Waste Technical Review Board
independentAgencies.comments: 2/17/20: Added CJ link upon agency request

independentAgencies.name: Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission
independentAgencies.mission: Provide an impartial forum for the just and prompt adjudication of workplace safety and health disputes involving the Department of Labor, employers, and employees, and/or their representatives under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 (Act), 29 U.S.C. 651-678.

subtiers.name: Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission

independentAgencies.name: Office of Government Ethics
independentAgencies.mission: Provide overall leadership and oversight of the executive branch ethics program designed to prevent and resolve conflicts of interest.

independentAgencies.name: Office of Special Counsel
independentAgencies.mission: OSC's primary mission is to safeguard the merit system by protecting federal employees and applicants from prohibited personnel practices, especially reprisal for whistleblowing.

independentAgencies.comments: Commision closed due to lack of funding

independentAgencies.name: Office of the Nuclear Waste Negotiator
independentAgencies.comments: Abolished in 1995. Not marking as TopTier b/c abolished and no SubTier. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: Overseas Private Investment Corporation
independentAgencies.description: On January 2nd, 2020, OPIC was replaced by DFC. In addition to absorbing OPIC, DFC also combined aspects of USAID,  including chiefly its Development Credit Authority (DCA). For DATA Act reporting purposes, the newly-created DFC continued to report as OPIC until its last submission in FY20Q4, but began to include the full set of DFC TAS in FY20Q3. DFC's first submission as DFC was in FY21Q1.

independentAgencies.name: Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Trust Fund
independentAgencies.mission: Provide for the coordination of relevant Federal health programs to build data capacity for comparative clinical effectiveness research, including the development and use of clinical registries and health outcomes research networks, in order to develop and maintain a comprehensive, interoperable data network to collect, link, and analyze data on outcomes and effectiveness from multiple sources including electronic health records.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Patient Centered Outcomes Research Trust Fund
independentAgencies.comments: 10-24-19 update: Does submit to Broker, but doesn't have a SubTier or seemingly submit contracts or FA (should it? Probably not). Needs an icon on the website to go with its new agency page if one can be found.

independentAgencies.name: Presidio Trust
independentAgencies.mission: In partnership with the National Park Service and the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, and at no cost to taxpayers, the Presidio Trust brings alive the unique historic, natural, and recreational assets of the Presidio for the inspiration, education, health, and enjoyment of all people.
independentAgencies.comments: 12/30/21: added several items for Presidio

independentAgencies.name: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

subtiers.name: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

independentAgencies.name: Public Buildings Reform Board
independentAgencies.mission: Reducing the costs of Federal real estate by identifying Federal civilian real properties that can be consolidated, co-located, reconfigured or disposed of; creating the highest value and return for the taxpayer and returning excess properties to communities for reinvestment and redevelopment.
independentAgencies.comments: Added on 7/11/19 due to appearance in the CARS file. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and has never submitted. Update on 6/16/20: adding as a TopTier due to agency request. Apparently they want to start submitting. Added website and CJ and mission. Still no SubTier. Leaving user selectable false b/c it just affects award dropdowns and there is no SubTier. 8/3/22: added a SubTier code after it showed up in the award data.

independentAgencies.name: Railroad Retirement Board
independentAgencies.mission: The RRB's mission is to administer retirement/survivor and unemployment/sickness insurance benefit programs for railroad workers and their families under the Railroad Retirement Act and the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act.  These programs provide income protection during old age and in the event of disability, death or temporary unemployment and sickness.  The RRB also administers aspects of the Medicare program and has administrative responsibilities under the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code.  In carrying out its mission, the RRB will pay benefits to the right people, in the right amounts, in a timely manner, and will take appropriate action to safeguard our customers' trust funds.  The RRB will treat every person who comes into contact with the agency with courtesy and concern, and respond to all inquiries promptly, accurately and clearly.

independentAgencies.name: Recovery Accountability and Transparency Board
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Recovery Act Accountability and Transparency Board
independentAgencies.comments: Pretty sure this is defunct now but we can keep for historical purposes.

independentAgencies.name: Ronald Reagan Centennial Commission
independentAgencies.comments: Terminated as of 2011 it appears. Not marking as a TopTier since doesn't have a SubTier and because terminated. Update in June 2021: for some reason, these not being toptier caused an issue with USAS, so we are changing this to TopTier. Should not have any negative effect

independentAgencies.name: Securities and Exchange Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of the SEC is to protect investors; maintain fair, orderly, and efficient markets; and facilitate capital formation. The SEC strives to promote a market environment that is worthy of the public's trust.

independentAgencies.name: Selective Service System
independentAgencies.mission: To provide manpower to the Defense Department during a national emergency, to manage alternative service for men classified as conscientious objectors, and to register, with only a few exceptions, all male U.S. citizens and male immigrants residing in the United States who are ages 18 through 25.

independentAgencies.name: Smithsonian Institution
independentAgencies.comments: Note: only NGA and KENNEDY ARE registered in the Broker.

independentAgencies.name: Southeast Crescent Regional Commission
independentAgencies.mission: The Southeast Crescent Regional Commission's mission is to build sustainable communities and strengthen economic growth across the Southeast Crescent region.
independentAgencies.comments: 1/9/2025: Added as a new agency to the agency_codes.csv

independentAgencies.name: Surface Transportation Board
independentAgencies.mission: The STB serves as an effective Federal forum for efficient resolution of surface transportation issues and disputes subject to its jurisdiction. The STB is vested with both adjudicatory and policy-making functions and exercises regulatory oversight efficiently and fairly, while working to integrate market forces.
independentAgencies.comments: 5/2/19: at some point in the last year, STB started using 9505 as a SubTier code. The previous code, 6969, was a legacy of their time as part of DOT (CGAC = 069). At some point after becoming a separate agency, this 9605 SubTier was created so that the SubTier numbering would no longer imply it remained part of DOT.

independentAgencies.name: U.S. Agency for Global Media
independentAgencies.mission: The mission of United States Agency for Global Media (USAGM) is to inform, engage, and connect people around the world in support of freedom and democracy.
independentAgencies.comments: 12/29/19: changed to USAGM from BBG at both SubTier and TopTier level. Also changed website and removed CJ (b/c non-functional)

independentAgencies.name: U.S. Interagency Council on Homelessness
independentAgencies.mission: To coordinate the federal response to homelessness and to create a national partnership at every level of government and with the private sector to reduce and end homelessness in the nation while maximizing the effectiveness of the federal government in contributing to the end of homelessness.
independentAgencies.comments: This seems redundant with the other entry for CGAC 376

independentAgencies.name: U.S. International Development Finance Corporation
independentAgencies.mission: U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) is America’s development bank. DFC partners with the private sector to finance solutions to the most critical challenges facing the developing world today. We invest across sectors including energy, healthcare, critical infrastructure, and technology. DFC also provides financing for small businesses and women entrepreneurs in order to create jobs in emerging markets. DFC investments adhere to high standards and respect the environment, human rights, and worker rights.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: United States International Development Finance Corporation

adminOrg.name: United States International Development Finance Corporation

independentAgencies.description: On January 2nd, 2020, OPIC was replaced by DFC. In addition to absorbing OPIC, DFC also combined aspects of USAID,  including chiefly its Development Credit Authority (DCA). For DATA Act reporting purposes, the newly-created DFC continued to report as OPIC until its last submission in FY20Q4, but began to include the full set of DFC TAS in FY20Q3. DFC's first submission as DFC was in FY21Q1.
independentAgencies.comments: Added entire row on 2/17. Going to cause a mess given that it subsumed OPIC, which has a different AID and SubTier. Will probably have to change OPIC's FREC CGAC Association flag etc and hardcode weird treatment of this to get it to show up right.

independentAgencies.name: United States Chemical Safety Board
independentAgencies.mission: Drive chemical safety change through independent investigations to protect people and the environment.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board
independentAgencies.comments: June 2021: changed to IS_FREC = FALSE. Not sure why it was marked TRUE earlier. May have been a mistake when 511 was converted to FREC.

independentAgencies.name: United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
independentAgencies.mission: The court has jurisdiction to, inter alia, (1) review decisions of the Board of Veterans' Appeals (Board) and may affirm, vacate, reverse, or remand as appropriate in such cases, (2) issue all writs necessary or appropriate in aid of its jurisdiction (28 U.S.C. 1651), (3) set aside rules, and regulations issues or adopted by the Secretary, the Board, or the Board Chairman that are arbitrary or capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law, contrary to constitutional right, in excess of statutory jurisdiction or authority, or without observance of the procesdures required by law, and (4) compel actions of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs that were unlawfully withheld or unreasonably delayed.
independentAgencies.frecDescription: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims

subtiers.name: United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
